table.name: metric_rollups
table.viewSql: SELECT metric_rollups_base.id, metric_rollups_base."timestamp", metric_rollups_base.capture_interval, metric_rollups_base.resource_type, metric_rollups_base.resource_id, metric_rollups_base.cpu_usage_rate_average, metric_rollups_base.cpu_usagemhz_rate_average, metric_rollups_base.mem_usage_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.disk_usage_rate_average, metric_rollups_base.net_usage_rate_average, metric_rollups_base.sys_uptime_absolute_latest, metric_rollups_base.created_on, metric_rollups_base.derived_cpu_available, metric_rollups_base.derived_memory_available, metric_rollups_base.derived_memory_used, metric_rollups_base.derived_cpu_reserved, metric_rollups_base.derived_memory_reserved, metric_rollups_base.derived_vm_count_on, metric_rollups_base.derived_host_count_on, metric_rollups_base.derived_vm_count_off, metric_rollups_base.derived_host_count_off, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_total, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_free, metric_rollups_base.capture_interval_name, metric_rollups_base.assoc_ids, metric_rollups_base.cpu_ready_delta_summation, metric_rollups_base.cpu_system_delta_summation, metric_rollups_base.cpu_wait_delta_summation, metric_rollups_base.resource_name, metric_rollups_base.cpu_used_delta_summation, metric_rollups_base.tag_names, metric_rollups_base.parent_host_id, metric_rollups_base.parent_ems_cluster_id, metric_rollups_base.parent_storage_id, metric_rollups_base.parent_ems_id, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_vm_count_registered, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_vm_count_unregistered, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_vm_count_unmanaged, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_used_registered, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_used_unregistered, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_used_unmanaged, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_snapshot_registered, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_snapshot_unregistered, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_snapshot_unmanaged, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_mem_registered, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_mem_unregistered, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_mem_unmanaged, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_disk_registered, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_disk_unregistered, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_disk_unmanaged, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_vm_count_managed, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_used_managed, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_snapshot_managed, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_mem_managed, metric_rollups_base.derived_storage_disk_managed, metric_rollups_base.min_max, metric_rollups_base.intervals_in_rollup, metric_rollups_base.mem_vmmemctl_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.mem_vmmemctltarget_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.mem_swapin_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.mem_swapout_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.mem_swapped_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.mem_swaptarget_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.disk_devicelatency_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.disk_kernellatency_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.disk_queuelatency_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.derived_vm_used_disk_storage, metric_rollups_base.derived_vm_allocated_disk_storage, metric_rollups_base.derived_vm_numvcpus, metric_rollups_base.time_profile_id, metric_rollups_base.derived_host_sockets, metric_rollups_base.derived_host_count_total, metric_rollups_base.derived_vm_count_total, metric_rollups_base.stat_container_group_create_rate, metric_rollups_base.stat_container_group_delete_rate, metric_rollups_base.stat_container_image_registration_rate, metric_rollups_base.disk_totalreadlatency_absolute_average, metric_rollups_base.disk_totalwritelatency_absolute_average FROM metric_rollups_base;

table.name: metrics
table.viewSql: SELECT metrics_base.id, metrics_base."timestamp", metrics_base.capture_interval, metrics_base.resource_type, metrics_base.resource_id, metrics_base.cpu_usage_rate_average, metrics_base.cpu_usagemhz_rate_average, metrics_base.mem_usage_absolute_average, metrics_base.disk_usage_rate_average, metrics_base.net_usage_rate_average, metrics_base.sys_uptime_absolute_latest, metrics_base.created_on, metrics_base.derived_cpu_available, metrics_base.derived_memory_available, metrics_base.derived_memory_used, metrics_base.derived_cpu_reserved, metrics_base.derived_memory_reserved, metrics_base.derived_vm_count_on, metrics_base.derived_host_count_on, metrics_base.derived_vm_count_off, metrics_base.derived_host_count_off, metrics_base.derived_storage_total, metrics_base.derived_storage_free, metrics_base.capture_interval_name, metrics_base.assoc_ids, metrics_base.cpu_ready_delta_summation, metrics_base.cpu_system_delta_summation, metrics_base.cpu_wait_delta_summation, metrics_base.resource_name, metrics_base.cpu_used_delta_summation, metrics_base.tag_names, metrics_base.parent_host_id, metrics_base.parent_ems_cluster_id, metrics_base.parent_storage_id, metrics_base.parent_ems_id, metrics_base.derived_storage_vm_count_registered, metrics_base.derived_storage_vm_count_unregistered, metrics_base.derived_storage_vm_count_unmanaged, metrics_base.derived_storage_used_registered, metrics_base.derived_storage_used_unregistered, metrics_base.derived_storage_used_unmanaged, metrics_base.derived_storage_snapshot_registered, metrics_base.derived_storage_snapshot_unregistered, metrics_base.derived_storage_snapshot_unmanaged, metrics_base.derived_storage_mem_registered, metrics_base.derived_storage_mem_unregistered, metrics_base.derived_storage_mem_unmanaged, metrics_base.derived_storage_disk_registered, metrics_base.derived_storage_disk_unregistered, metrics_base.derived_storage_disk_unmanaged, metrics_base.derived_storage_vm_count_managed, metrics_base.derived_storage_used_managed, metrics_base.derived_storage_snapshot_managed, metrics_base.derived_storage_mem_managed, metrics_base.derived_storage_disk_managed, metrics_base.min_max, metrics_base.intervals_in_rollup, metrics_base.mem_vmmemctl_absolute_average, metrics_base.mem_vmmemctltarget_absolute_average, metrics_base.mem_swapin_absolute_average, metrics_base.mem_swapout_absolute_average, metrics_base.mem_swapped_absolute_average, metrics_base.mem_swaptarget_absolute_average, metrics_base.disk_devicelatency_absolute_average, metrics_base.disk_kernellatency_absolute_average, metrics_base.disk_queuelatency_absolute_average, metrics_base.derived_vm_used_disk_storage, metrics_base.derived_vm_allocated_disk_storage, metrics_base.derived_vm_numvcpus, metrics_base.time_profile_id, metrics_base.derived_host_sockets, metrics_base.derived_host_count_total, metrics_base.derived_vm_count_total, metrics_base.disk_totalreadlatency_absolute_average, metrics_base.disk_totalwritelatency_absolute_average FROM metrics_base;

column.name: embedded_methods
column.remarks: Ordered list of embedded method names

column.name: tracking_label
column.remarks: label to track requests through the system

column.name: id
column.remarks: [builtin] The internal record ID. This is the primary key.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The name of the task. Typically doubles as a description.

column.name: state
column.remarks: The current state of the task - Initialized, Queued, Active, Finished, etc.

column.name: status
column.remarks: The current status of the task - Ok, Warn, Error, Timeout, Expired, or Unknown.

column.name: message
column.remarks: Message associated with the task for logging or UI purposes.

column.name: userid
column.remarks: The userid that created the task, or 'system' if created by the appliance.

column.name: created_on
column.remarks: [builtin] The timestamp the record was created.

column.name: updated_on
column.remarks: [builtin] The timestamp the record was last updated.

column.name: pct_complete
column.remarks: The current completion percentage of the task.

column.name: context_data
column.remarks: Serialized metadata that may contain more detailed information about the task.

column.name: results
column.remarks: Task execution result. Deprecated.

column.name: miq_server_id
column.remarks: The ID of the ManageIQ server where the task was executed.

column.name: identifier
column.remarks: The resource this task is related to in 'class:id' format.

column.name: started_on
column.remarks: The timestamp the task was actually started.

column.name: zone
column.remarks: The zone in which the task should be executed, or any zone if null.

column.name: initiator
column.remarks: Entity that initiated the service creation

column.name: data_snapshot
column.remarks: Snapshot of the data of showbackevent

column.name: id
column.remarks: The internal database ID.

column.name: vendor
column.remarks: The vendor for the VM, e.g. azure, amazon, etc.

column.name: format
column.remarks: The format of the VM's disk, such as vmdk, qcow2, and tier1.

column.name: version
column.remarks: The version of the VM definition.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The name of the VM/Template.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A description of the VM that is typically set by the provider, but may also be edited.

column.name: location
column.remarks: The location of the VM, or its underlying storage.

column.name: config_xml
column.remarks: The VM or Template configuration in XML format. Deprecated.

column.name: autostart
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not the VM is set to autostart.

column.name: host_id
column.remarks: ID of the host that the VM/Template resides on.

column.name: last_sync_on
column.remarks: Timestamp for last SmartState analysis synchronization.

column.name: created_on
column.remarks: The timestamp the VM was added to the app inventory.

column.name: updated_on
column.remarks: The last timestamp the VM was modified within the app.

column.name: storage_id
column.remarks: ID of the storage object associated with the VM.

column.name: guid
column.remarks: A value used to uniquely identify the VM internally.

column.name: ems_id
column.remarks: ID of the ExtManagementSystem associated with the VM.

column.name: last_scan_on
column.remarks: Timestamp for last SmartState analysis scan.

column.name: last_scan_attempt_on
column.remarks: Timestamp for last attempt to perform SmartState Analysis.

column.name: uid_ems
column.remarks: A globally unique reference for the VM across EMS.

column.name: retires_on
column.remarks: Timestamp the VM is to be retired.

column.name: retired
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not the VM is retired.

column.name: boot_time
column.remarks: The last time the VM was started.

column.name: tools_status
column.remarks: Status of guest tools.

column.name: standby_action
column.remarks: Action taken when VM is put into standby mode.

column.name: power_state
column.remarks: The current power state, typically 'on' or 'off'.

column.name: state_changed_on
column.remarks: The timestamp of the last power state change.

column.name: previous_state
column.remarks: The previous power state change.

column.name: connection_state
column.remarks: Indicates the connection state of the VM, e.g. connected, disconnected, etc.

column.name: last_perf_capture_on
column.remarks: Timestamp for last performance metrics capture.

column.name: registered
column.remarks: Indicates whether the VM registered to a Provider. Deprecated.

column.name: busy
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not the VM is being scanned for SmartState analysis. Deprecated.

column.name: smart
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not smart proxy is enabled. Deprecated.

column.name: memory_reserve
column.remarks: Amount of memory that is guaranteed available for the VM.

column.name: memory_reserve_expand
column.remarks: Amount the memory can grow beyond its normal limits if there are unreserved resources available.

column.name: memory_limit
column.remarks: The absolute memory limit for the VM.

column.name: memory_shares
column.remarks: The number of memory shares allocated. Used to determine resource allocation in case of resource contention.

column.name: memory_shares_level
column.remarks: Memory shares allocation level.

column.name: cpu_reserve
column.remarks: Amount of CPU that is guaranteed available for the VM.

column.name: cpu_reserve_expand
column.remarks: Amount the CPU can grow beyond its normal limits if there are unreserved resources available.

column.name: cpu_limit
column.remarks: The CPU utilization limit for the VM.

column.name: cpu_shares
column.remarks: The number of CPU shares allocated. Used to determine resource allocation in case of resource contention.

column.name: cpu_shares_level
column.remarks: CPU shares allocation level.

column.name: cpu_affinity
column.remarks: A comma separated list of host CPUs to schedule the VM on.

column.name: ems_created_on
column.remarks: The timestamp the VM or Templated was created on the EMS itself.

column.name: template
column.remarks: Indicates whether this is a VM or template.

column.name: evm_owner_id
column.remarks: Typically, the ID of the user that provisioned the VM (if provisioned through the app).Can also be set via inventory, the UI or Automate.

column.name: miq_group_id
column.remarks: ID of the MIQ Group owner.

column.name: linked_clone
column.remarks: Indicates whether the VM is a linked clone, i.e its disk is a referencing disk pointing to snapshot of another VM.

column.name: fault_tolerance
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not the VM is fault tolerant, i.e. if one host crashes it will immediately pick up on another host in the cluster.

column.name: type
column.remarks: An internal class name that includes the provider type.

column.name: ems_ref
column.remarks: A native unique reference for the VM within the EMS.

column.name: ems_cluster_id
column.remarks: ID of associated cluster.

column.name: retirement_warn
column.remarks: Warning message when VM was put into retirement.

column.name: retirement_last_warn
column.remarks: Date of last retirement warning.

column.name: vnc_port
column.remarks: Port or port range used for VNC connections.

column.name: flavor_id
column.remarks: ID of associated flavor.

column.name: availability_zone_id
column.remarks: ID of the availability zone that the VM is part of.

column.name: cloud
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not the VM/Template is cloud or infra.

column.name: retirement_state
column.remarks: The current retirement state.

column.name: cloud_network_id
column.remarks: ID of the cloud (virtual) network the VM/Template is associated with.

column.name: cloud_subnet_id
column.remarks: Subnet ID associated with the VM.

column.name: cloud_tenant_id
column.remarks: ID of the cloud tenant associated with the VM.

column.name: raw_power_state
column.remarks: The power state refreshed from the EMS.

column.name: publicly_available
column.remarks: Indicates whether the VM is public or private.

column.name: orchestration_stack_id
column.remarks: ID of the orchestration stack associated with the VM.

column.name: retirement_requester
column.remarks: Userid of the user who requested retirement.

column.name: tenant_id
column.remarks: ID of the tenant associated with the VM.

column.name: resource_group_id
column.remarks: ID of the resource group that the VM/Template belongs to.

column.name: deprecated
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not a template is deprecated.

column.name: storage_profile_id
column.remarks: ID of the storage profile associated with the VM.

column.name: cpu_hot_add_enabled
column.remarks: Indicates if CPUs can be added to the VM while it is powered on.

column.name: cpu_hot_remove_enabled
column.remarks: Indicates if a CPU can be removed from a VM while powered on.

column.name: memory_hot_add_enabled
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not memory can be hot added to the running VM.

column.name: memory_hot_add_limit
column.remarks: The maximum amount of memory, in MB, that can be added to a running VM.

column.name: memory_hot_add_increment
column.remarks: Memory in MB that can be added to a running VM must be in increments of this value.
